substitution.copyText: Ham. A King of shredsa nd patches. | Save me and hover o're me with your wings | You heavenly guards: what would your gracious fire?
substitution.amendedText: Save me and hover o're me with your wings, | You heavenly guards! what would your gracious form?

substitution.copyText: Ham. Do you not come your tardy son to chide. | That lap'st in time, and person lets go by | Th'important acting of your dead command? O say!
substitution.amendedText: Ham. Do you not come your tardy son to chide, | That lap'st in time - and passion lets go by | Th'important acting of your dread command? O say!

substitution.copyText: Ham, How is it with you Lady?
substitution.amendedText: Ham, How is it with you, Lady?

substitution.copyText: And as the sleeping Souldiers in th'alarm
substitution.amendedText: And as th'affrighted Souldier's in th'alarm

substitution.copyText: Ham. On him, on him, look you how pale he gleres, | His form and cause conjoyn'd, preaching to stones | Would make them capable; do not look upon me, | Lest with this piteous action you convert | My stern effects; then what I have to do | Will want true color, tears perchance for blood.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. On him, on him! look you how pale he glares! | His form and cause conjoyn'd, preaching to stones | Would make them capable. do not look on me, | Lest with this piteous action you convert | My stern effects; then what I have to do | Will want true color; tears, perchance, for blood.

substitution.copyText: Qu. Nothing at all, yet all that is here I see.
substitution.amendedText: Qu. Nothing at all, yet all that's here I see.

substitution.copyText: Ham. Why look you there, look how it steals away, | My father in his habit as he liv'd, | Look where he goes, even now out at the portal,
substitution.amendedText: Ham. Why look you there, look how it stalks away, | My father in his habit as he liv'd! | Look, where he goes, even now out at the portal,

substitution.copyText: Qu. This is the very coinage of your brain, | This bodiless creation extasie is very cunning in.
substitution.amendedText: Qu. This is the very coinage of your brain.

substitution.copyText: Ham. My pulse as yours doth temperately keep time, | And makes as healthful musick: it is not madness | That I have uttered, bring me to the test, | And I the matter will re-word, which madness | Would cannot do. Mother, for love of grace
